intro: Richetia chaiana, commonly known as the Florida flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of water bodies, preferring moist, sandy soils. Richetia chaiana is often found in the Florida Keys and is an important component of the local wetland ecosystem.
